content: autonomy by rosemary romi hill inspired by the green bandanas and handkerchiefs i ve seen throughout the world at abortion access protests starting almost 20 years ago in argentina the autonomy cowl pattern was designed to help raise funds for groups making full reproductive healthcare more available to all the dk version shown at top takes only about 100-110 yards of yarn and the fingering weight pattern hack shown at bottom takes about 150 yards there is charted patterning and also directions on omitting the patterning for a plain cowl if desired any shade of green that fits your personality is perfect use #romiphyle and #romihill or #romidesigns to connect on social media find me at romidesigns on instagram and twitter 07072022 size one adjustable measurements circumference unstretched 20 inches depth 20 inches without tassel measurements taken after blocking washing laying flat to dry sample was not stretched or pinned materials dk weight wool approximately 110 yards/50g green one skein top sample on cover niagara colorway from ewe-nited states of fiber 1 - set each 16 inch length circular knitting needles in us 8/5mm and us 6/4mm locking stitch marker plain stitch markers tapestry needle tassel maker or cardboard to wrap tassel gauge 16 sts/32 row = 4 /10cm in garter stitch after mild blocking wash lay flat to dry or steam block every knitter s gauge is different please check gauge exact gauge is not important however a looser gauge will result in the use of more yardage pattern switch to smaller needles note charts are presented with corresponding written instructions when a chart is named in the instructions the work round 3 an additional time and bind off on row 4 knitter may choose preferred format using stretchy bind off see abbreviations fasten_off the charts may be omitted if a plain garter stitch cowl is finishing desired rather than working the chart section repeat wash using wool wash and rinse thoroughly remove row 1 and 2 of the set-up section until 70 sts or desired excess water from cowl and lay flat to dry patting sides number have been worked then work joining section and top into shape sew tail at top of cowl into place and through the end of pattern trim set-up to add tassel wrap yarn around cardboard sample used leaving a tail of at least 8 inches to tie on tassel in final a 3-1/2 inch piece of cardboard wrapped 30 times and steps use larger needles and working yarn to cast on 2 then cut strands at one end the lengths of yarn are now stitches approximately 7 inches in length set aside cut length 10 inch length of yarn fold in half and then secure to tip of the triangle is constructed working back and forth from cowl there are now 3 lengths of yarn hanging from the bottom point the yo at the beginning of each row bottom tip of cowl knot all three strands together as close increases one stitch
